description: From Latin m≈çmentum. Doublet of moment and movement.

nouns.description: momentum (countable and uncountable, plural momentums or momenta)

entries.meaning: (physics) Of a body in motion: the tendency of a body to maintain its inertial motion; the product of its mass and velocity, or the vector sum of the products of its masses and velocities.
The impetus, either of a body in motion, or of an idea or course of events; a moment.
examples: The travellers swarm forth from the cars. All are full of the momentum which they have caught from their mode of conveyance.
